newsitem.title: FRANCE: France says ready to take part in Albania force.
newsitem.headline: France says ready to take part in Albania force.

text.p: France said on Tuesday it was willing to take part in an Italian-led multinational security force for Albania to protect humanitarian relief operations in the country.
"We are ready to participate in such an operation. We would like this force to be operational as soon as possible," Foreign Ministry spokesman Yves Doutriaux told reporters.

The 5,000-strong force is being put together by Italy after receiving approval from the United Nations on Friday. Among countries expected to contribute are Italy, France, Greece, Spain, Portugal, Romania and Turkey.
Doutriaux said France expected the Western European Union to play a role in the operation, and that the WEU would send a representative to a planning meeting due in Rome on Wednesday.
Albania's parliament, dominated by President Sali Berisha's Democratic Party, voted on Sunday to accept the multinational force.
